title: Modules

codeExamples.title: Basic Module
codeExamples.explanation: The mod keyword defines modules. The pub keyword makes functions public. The :: syntax references modules.

codeExamples.title: use Keyword
codeExamples.explanation: The use keyword allows us to use shortened names. This way we don't have to write the full module path every time.

codeExamples.title: Public Struct
codeExamples.explanation: A public struct's fields are private by default. The pub keyword makes them public. This provides encapsulation.

exercises.title: Creating a Module
exercises.description: Create a utils module with math functions!
hints: Don't forget the pub keyword for functions
